questions.text: Dick gets fired from being Robin when he's tardy to a bout with Clayface. Who or what was Clayface stealing?
options: Blueprints for a secret military installation
questions.explanation:
His own son.

	Batman and Robin defeated Clayface before the criminal could steal away his own son. Robin is late to the fight because he was helping the Teen Titans defeat Brother Blood, one of their foulest enemies. These events happened in "Nightwing" #101, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: According to Dick, he and Clark Kent are both fans of:
questions.explanation:
Hockey.

	Dick really knows Clark as the Man of Steel, Superman, but Lois Lane can't know that! To satisfy her reporter's suspicion, Dick claims that he and Clark are both fans of hockey. Clark tells Dick of an ancient Kryptonian hero named Nightwing who aided people much the way that Dick had. The meeting took place in "Nightwing" #102, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: While visiting his old circus pals, Dick runs into Deadman's brother. It's widely known that Deadman is actually Boston Brand, but what is the brother's name?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland.

	Cleveland Brand is a trapeze and high-wire artist just like Dick and his brother. Batman employs Deadman to possess the bodies of several people at the circus to keep tabs on Dick and ascertain his location. Cleveland makes fun of his own name in "Nightwing" #103, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: Who is the first to view Nightwing's first costume?
questions.explanation:
Jimmie the Monkey.

	Jimmie the Monkey blows raspberries at the newly-clad Dick Grayson, but despite the negative review, Dick stays with the costume, based off of his father's acrobat costume. Nightwing designed his costume in "Nightwing" #103, which debuted in 2005.

questions.text: At which fast-food place do Batgirl and Nightwing stop?
questions.explanation:
Belly Buster.

	Batgirl and Nightwing use the drive-through at Belly Buster for their impromptu date after beating up some ne'er-do-wells. Batgirl has to shell out for the meal because it's Dick's first night back in Gotham and he has precious little money. Dick and Batgirl chow down in "Nightwing" #104, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: Nightwing and Batgirl confront Penguin in "My Alibi".
questions.explanation:
No.

	"My Alibi" is one of the lounges that the duo visits in their fight against the criminal element, but the Penguin is found in his very own "Iceberg Lounge". After bragging that he can buy off any police officer in Gotham City, Penguin comes face to face with a man who loves justice and tobacco equally, Harvey Bullock. The Penguin got his comeuppance in "Nightwing" #104, which went on sale in 2005.

Alfred.

	Before becoming Batman's butler, Alfred was an actor, and the skills he retains from the job helped him impersonate Two-Face in order to test the new Robin, Jason Todd! Alfred began practicing in "Nightwing" #105, which debuted in 2005.

questions.text: What is Killer Croc looking to traffic in?
questions.explanation:
Guns.

	Killer Croc already peddles drugs like heroin and cocaine, but he's looking to expand into running guns, which is decidedly Two-Face's territory. Thus, it behooves him to capture Two-Face, who is actually Alfred in disguise! Killer Croc explains his expansionist desires in "Nightwing" #105, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: Aoccording to Nightwing, what's more fun than riding a motorcycle?
questions.correct: Riding  on top of a bus
options: Riding on top of a train
Riding on top on an elephant
Riding on top of a helicopter
questions.explanation:
Riding  on top of a bus.

	Nightwing goes further to say that one of the perks of being a costumed hero is that you don't have to pay for using public transportation! He's more excited about it than the new Robin, who is clearly petrified. Nightwing and Robin go for a ride in "Nightwing" #106, which debuted in 2005.

questions.text: Alfred sends Dick his second Nightwing costume.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The outfit comes with gold trim, gold being one of the primary colors of Dick's Robin costume. "Clothes do indeed make the man." thinks Dick as he looks back on his first year as Nightwing. Dick gets a gift in "Nightwing" #106, which went on sale in 2005.
